title: Can i sue my husband and his mistress for emotional damages.
question: I have been married to my husband for almost 10 years and i just found out here has been having an affair with another women for the past 8 years. I have lost it. I am now on anti depressants.
answers: No. It is not a cause of action in California. However, if he used community money to buy her things or take her places, you can possibly get the money back through a breach of fiduciary duty claim. You should visit a very experienced family law attorney near you for a face to face consultation and find out what you may be entitled to receive.

Sorry, but no. There's no California lawsuit for "alienation of affection", and no "correspondent" in California divorces. Dissolve the marriage, and ask for the assets and support to which you're entitled.
This is an alienation of affection claim. It is prohibited by CA law. my other colleagues offer you good advice .

No you can't do this but the remedy is called a dissolution of marriage and in which you might also need to claim spousal support and a fair and equators divison of assets and debts along with child support if there might be minor children. This is not actionable in California as you wish.
